title: Sachbearbeiter:in Vertragsverwaltung Individual Life
name: Sachbearbeiter:in Vertragsverwaltung Individual Life
description:
Komm zur AXA, der führenden Versicherung der Schweiz \- als
   

  

**Sachbearbeiter:in Vertragsverwaltung Individual Life** 
**60\-100 %
   

  

 Winterthur / Smart Working**
 Jede Erfolgsgeschichte beginnt mit dem Glauben an sich selbst.
   

  

 Als AXA sehen wir uns als Partnerin von dir, die an deiner Seite steht und an dich glaubt. Deshalb fordern und fördern aktiv und zeigen dir proaktiv Möglichkeiten für deine Zukunft auf. Wir ermutigen dich und bieten dir Freiräume, damit du die Dinge, die dir wichtig sind, mit deinem Privatleben verbinden kannst. Gemeinsam mit deinem Engagement und deinem individuellen Beitrag wird daraus eine zukunftsweisende Partnerschaft. Für dich, für uns und für unsere Kundinnen und Kunden.
   

  

 Schreibe jetzt mit uns deine eigene Erfolgsgeschichte. Know You Can.
   

  

 Zusammen mit deinem Team gestalten wir die individuellen Erlebnisse unserer Kundinnen und Kunden im Schaden\- und Leistungsfall empathisch, professionell und freundlich. So gewährleisten wir mit unserer Customer\-first\-Mentalität höchste Kundenzufriedenheit.
   

  

 Dein Beitrag
   

  

* Du arbeitest eigenständig und zielorientiert an allen Aufgaben, z. B.:
* Abwicklung und Auszahlung verschiedener Geschäftsvorfälle (Erlebens\-/Todesfall, Rückkauf, Begünstigung, Verpfändung, Abtretungen u. a.)
* Betreuung der Vertriebskanäle
* Schriftlicher und telefonischer Kontakt zu externen Kund:innen (Versicherte, Erben, Anwält:innen/Behörden) sowie Mitarbeitenden der Vertriebseinheiten
* Ansprechperson bei Fragestellungen
* Mitwirkung bei der Weiterentwicklung der Prozesse und Unterstützung der Prozessmanager:innen
* Bearbeitung von Kundenfeedback
* Du leistest aktiv Beitrag zur kontinuierlichen Prozessverbesserung
* Und das machst du nicht allein, sondern im Team mit deinen Kolleg:innen


 Deine Fähigkeiten und Talente
   

  

* Du bist mutig, motiviert, positiv eingestellt, empathisch, engagiert, teamfähig und belastbar. Du arbeitest auch gern unter Druck
* Du kommunizierst kundenorientiert – mündlich und schriftlich. Du sprichst Deutsch oder Französisch; weitere Sprachen sind willkommen
* Du hast kaufmännische Kenntnisse oder vergleichbare Erfahrung. Idealerweise bringst du Berufserfahrung im Bereich Private Vorsorge oder Versicherung mit


 Im Bereich Customer Operations gestalten wir die individuellen Erlebnisse unserer Kundinnen und Kunden im Schaden\- und Leistungsfall. Sie stehen bei uns im Mittelpunkt und gemeinsam mit ihnen finden wir die passende Lösung. So gewährleisten wir mit unserer Customer\-first\-Mentalität höchste Kundenzufriedenheit.
   

  

 Dein zukünftiger Arbeitsort
   

  

 Bewirb dich jetzt!
   

  

 Motivationsschreiben? Darauf verzichten wir. Wir freuen uns stattdessen über deine Antworten auf unsere kurzen Fragen zur Stelle im Online\-Bewerbungs\-Tool.
   

  

 Aus Datenschutzgründen werden nur Bewerbungen berücksichtigt, welche über den Online\-Bewerbungslink eingereicht werden.
   

  

 Hast du Fragen?
   

  

 Bei Fragen rund um diese Stelle ist Diana Carbognin, gerne für dich da, per
   

  

 Für diese Stelle können wir keine Bewerbungen über Personalvermittlungen berücksichtigen.
   

  

**Unser Bewerbungsprozess**
 Lerne unseren Bewerbungsprozess kennen und erhalte Antworten auf Fragen, die Bewerbende uns häufig stellen. Solltest du während des Bewerbungsprozesses Unterstützung benötigen, melde dich einfach. Die Kolleginnen und Kollegen vom Recruiting helfen dir gerne weiter.
   

  

**Vorteile**
 Gesundheit
   

  

* Eigenes AXA Gesundheitsmanagement
* Massageangebote
* Diverse Sport\- Entspannungskurse
* Healthmanagement Seminare
* Ruheräume


 Mobilität
   

  

* Erstattung von Halbtax\-Abo, GA (anteilig)
* Vergünstigter Bezug von Reka Checks
* Rabatte bei Autokauf, \-Leasing oder –Miete


 Job \& Familie
   

  

* 22 Wochen voll bezahlter Mutterschaftsurlaub
* 8 Wochen voll bezahlter Urlaub für den anderen Elternteil
* Betriebliche Familienzulagen
* Familienfreundliche Meetingzeiten
* Kostenloses Elterncoaching für Mitarbeitende


 Weitere Vorteile
   

  

* Jährlich 5000 Swipoints (Wert CHF 500\.\-) zum Einsatz auf swibeco.ch
* AXA Shareplan
* Vergünstigte Verpflegung durch Lunchcard oder Personalrestaurants
* Rabatte für Shopping, Events, Freizeitangebote


 Versicherung
   

  

* Rabatt von bis zu 30% auf Produkte der AXA
* Privatversicherung bei Berufs\- und Nichtberufsunfällen


 Flexibilität und Freiräume
   

  

* Diverse flexible Arbeitsmodelle (Smart Working und Flexwork)
* Mindestens 5 Wochen Ferien
* 2 Wochen Feriengeschenk alle 5 Jahre
* Flexibler Ferienkauf von bis zu 10 Tagen
* 3 Tage persönliche Lernzeit


 Pensionskasse
   

  

* Leistungen der Pensionskasse und Arbeitgeberbeiträge weit über dem gesetzlichen Minimum
* Freie Wahl des Sparplans
* Flexibilität bei der Pensionierung


****Über AXA****
 Jede Erfolgsgeschichte beginnt mit dem Glauben an sich selbst.
   

  

 Als AXA sehen wir uns als Partnerin, die an deiner Seite steht und an dich glaubt. Deshalb fordern und fördern wir dich und zeigen dir proaktiv Möglichkeiten für deine Zukunft auf. Wir ermutigen dich und bieten dir Freiräume, damit du die Dinge, die dir wichtig sind, miteinander verbinden kannst. Gemeinsam mit deinem Engagement und deinem individuellen Beitrag wird daraus eine zukunftsweisende Partnerschaft. Für dich, für uns und für unsere Kundinnen und Kunden. Und das nicht nur für den Moment. Sondern auf lange Sicht.
   

  

 Schreibe jetzt mit uns deine eigene Erfolgsgeschichte.
 **Know You Can.**
**Smart Working**
 Bei der AXA setzen wir auf Vertrauen, Flexibilität und Teamarbeit. Im Zentrum unseres neuen Arbeitsmodells "Smart Working" steht dein Beitrag zu den Unternehmenszielen und nicht der Ort, an dem du arbeitest.
   

  

**Diversity \& Inclusion**
 Vielfalt, Chancengerechtigkeit und Inklusion liegen uns bei der AXA am Herzen. Unsere Unternehmenskultur fördert Respekt und Offenheit, damit jede Person bei uns ihr volles Potential entfalten kann.
   

  

**Darauf sind wir stolz**
 Wir möchten unseren Mitarbeitenden ein bestmögliches Arbeitsumfeld bieten. Diese und andere Siegel bestärken uns darin.

title: Junior Analysis Engineer
name: Junior Analysis Engineer
description:
The
 **Junior Analysis Engineer** 
 supports the engineering team by performing structural and mechanical analyses, simulations, and optimizations. This role is ideal for candidates passionate about aerospace engineering and eager to develop key competencies in a dynamic environment.
 



  





**Responsabilities**




  




* Analyze technical specifications, interface documents, and job descriptions.
* Develop mathematical models and perform structural\-mechanical simulations and optimizations using
 **MSC NASTRAN** 
 and
 **Altair Hyperworks (Optistruct)** 
 .
* Conduct strength analyses for lightweight structures.
* Create predictions and correlations for static and dynamic experiments.
* Prepare technical reports and presentations (primarily in English).
* Participate in meetings, reviews, and present work to clients.
* Contribute to improving Stress Office expertise and efficiency (new methods, tools, standardization).
* Plan, coordinate, and monitor technical project work in calculation areas.
* Manage budgets and deadlines for calculation activities.
* Respond to RIDs (Review Item Discrepancies).



  





**Requirements**




  




* Master’s degree in
 **Mechanical Engineering** 
 or
 **Aerospace Engineering** 
 (University/ETH).
* Experience in aerospace or equivalent fields, including:
* FE Analysis with
 **MSC NASTRAN** 
 ,
 **Altair Hyperworks/Optistruct** 
 , and/or
 **Abaqus \& NX Siemens** 
 .
* FEM simulation of vibro\-acoustic phenomena.
* Structural analysis and mechanical engineering.
* Proficiency in FE analysis using NASTRAN, Optistruct, and/or Abaqus \& NX Siemens.
* Knowledge of static and dynamic analysis.
* Experience automating FEM simulations using
 **Python API** 
 .
* Familiarity with structures, mechanisms, and solar wings.
* Analysis of composites, sandwich structures, and lightweight materials is a plus.
* Knowledge of structures, mechanisms, and antennas is nice to have.
* Understanding of mechanical layout for aerospace structures and components.
* Advanced English skills (reading, writing, speaking).



  





**If your profile matches the requirements of the position, we will contact you within the next fifteen (15\) days of submitting your application. Otherwise, please kindly consider that your application is unsuccessful.** 




**Please note, that we only accept applicants with Swiss or EU/EFTA citizenship or applicants with an existing and valid residence and work permit for Switzerland.** 




**Capgemini Engineering is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Individuals with Disabilities.** 




  





**Our offer**




  




* A permanent contract with the leader in innovation and high\-tech engineering consulting.
* A multi\-stage model with career opportunities through specialization prospects with over 250'000 consultants around the world and a Group revenue of EUR. 17 Bn, the Capgemini Group is the undisputed global leader in Engineering and R\&D services (ER\&D).
* In Switzerland, Capgemini employs more than 400 consultants and aims towards large growth with offices located in Zürich, Basel, Bern, Lausanne and Geneva.
* 30% to 70% remote work in agreement with your line manager and client needs.
* Trust\-based managerial culture.
* Team rituals and get togethers.
* Options to order ergonomically proven Equipment (monitor \& chair) for your home office premises.

title: Process Engineer - Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
name: Process Engineer - Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
**Agap2** 
 is an European engineering and operational consulting group founded in 2005 and specialized in the industry. We work in the Pharma, Biotechnology, Medical Devices, Energy, Infrastructure, Transportation, Chemicals, and Information Technology sectors.
 



 As a consultant, you will have to support our clients in the realization of their projects on site by bringing your expertise and your skills.
 



 You are agile and eager to adapt to different work environments that will fuel your curiosity of seeing what’s behind closed doors of the biggest projects of our client’s portfolio.
 



  





**Main tasks:**



* **Design \& Execution:** 
 Lead
 **Front\-End Engineering Design (FEED)** 
 ,
 **Basic** 
 , and
 **Detailed Design** 
 for complex
 **cGMP** 
 process systems (e.g., bioreactors, UF/DF, CIP) and utility skids.
* **Technical Documentation:** 
 Develop and maintain compliant
 **PFDs** 
 ,
 **P\&IDs** 
 , and
 **User Requirement Specifications (URS)** 
 , ensuring adherence to
 **GMP** 
 and regulatory standards.
* **Engineering Analysis:** 
 Execute rigorous
 **mass and energy balances** 
 and
 **process simulations** 
 (e.g., AspenTech) for precise equipment sizing and specification.
* **Project \& Quality:** 
 Manage vendor qualification,
 **FAT/SAT** 
 , and procurement for bespoke equipment.



  





**Required qualifications:**



* **Education:** 
 Bachelor's/Master's in Pharma/Biotechnology or Chemical Engineering
* **Experience:** 
**5\+ years** 
 in a
 **validated cGMP** 
 pharmaceutical or bioprocessing environment
* **Expertise:** 
 Deep knowledge of
 **aseptic processing** 
 ,
 **fluid dynamics** 
 , and equipment sizing
* **Languages:** 
 Fluent English, a fluent German level is also mandatory



  





**Benefits:**



* Joining a group with strong development potential that aims to improve your employability on challenging and varied projects.
* Joining a structure that has been established in Switzerland for a long time with a client portfolio that includes leaders in the sector.
* Having a sustainable job with stability and access to a real collaboration.
* Benefit from training with accredited and certified centers.
* Having a local management team to support you in the achievement of your missions and in the development of your career.
* Being part of a dynamic, committed team with real human values that we live by every day.

title: Composite Production Engineer
name: Composite Production Engineer
description:
**Our Team**
 Welcome to the Audi F1 Project.
   

  

 Audi will be competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship from 2026\.
   

  

 The new team has three locations. Audi's Motorsport Competence Center in Neuburg (Germany) is considered one of the most modern of its kind in Europe. The Sauber Group's Formula 1 factory in Hinwil (Switzerland) is known for its innovative technologies and passion for racing. The Sauber Motorsport Technical Center, UK will be operational this year. Our Power Unit comes from Neuburg, while Hinwil is responsible for the development of the chassis and race operations.
   

  

 What you need? The mindset of an athlete. If you are someone for whom giving up isn’t an option and limits are just something to be overcome, you can bring Vorsprung durch Technik to Formula 1 with us. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history.
   

  

 This position for the Audi F1 Project is at Sauber in Hinwil (Switzerland).
   

  

**Your mission**
* Be the daily interface between production and design office
* Support design and production in developing and optimizing components
* Provide technical support to the involved departments and transfer information to manufacture the tool or part
* Test materials, ensure quality is maintained in the area of composite part manufacturing and take decisions regarding quality issues of non\-class A parts (e.g. inserts, foams, bodywork parts, etc.)
* Maintain an overview of manufacturing quality once the component is productionised in the manufacturing departments
* Ensure problem solving is efficient and transparent throughout the entire design/manufacturing processes
* Support projects and participate in the direction and development of composite manufacturing implementations


**Your profile**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering or equivalent qualification/experience
* A minimum of 5 years of experience with high and autoclave cured composites
* Evident expertise and accomplishments in all fields of composite manufacturing as well as good knowledge of various composite manufacturing methods
* Knowledge of CAD, CATIA V6 preferred and the ability to use standard SW packages (e.g. MS Office)
* Excellent technical, organizational and communicative competencies with the ability to take initiatives and be responsible
* Creative, self\-motivated, honest and open\-minded personality with high flexibility for working in a shift model (early and night shifts)
* Proficiency in English language skills. German language skills will be an advantage

title: Production Technology Engineer
name: Production Technology Engineer
description:
Aufgaben
   

  

* Planen und Durchführen von Kosten\-, Fertigungsprozess\- und Produkt\-Analysen mit End\-to\-End\-Fokus zwecks Gewinnung von tiefgreifendem Prozessverständnis und Identifikation von Kostentreibern, Effektivitätssteigerungs\-Potenzial sowie technologischem Grenznutzen
* Entwicklung und Optimierung innovativer, hochkompetitiver und komplexen Lösungen mit neuen Technologien von industriellen Fertigungsprozessen zur Steigerung von Effizienz, Qualität und langfristigen, finanzieller Nachhaltigkeit
* Planen, Steuern und Überwachen von internationalen (Teil\-)Projekten (inkl. Zeitplan, Ressourcen, Budget)
* Implementieren und Industrialisieren von fortschrittlichen Fertigungslösungen inkl. Dokumentation mit Betreuung während der Hypercare\-Phase nach der Inbetriebnahme
* Moderation und Beitrag zum globalen Austausch von Know\-how, Best Practices und Lessons Learned im Bereich von Fertigungslösungen und \-technologien


 Wir bieten
   

  

* Eine anspruchsvolle und strategisch wichtige Engineering\-Rolle in der BAUMANN Gruppe, die es den Divisionen ermöglicht, neue Wege zu gehen und sich durch Technologievorsprung abzuheben
* Gestaltungsspielraum und die Möglichkeit, mit radikalen Ideen und neuen Technologien direkt Einfluss auf Produktion, Produkt, Zufriedenheit der Kunden und somit der Zukunft der Firma zu nehmen
* Möglichkeiten zur fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung durch komplexe Aufgaben und die Integration bahnbrechender Technologien
* Ein kollaboratives, unterstützendes und motivierendes Team in einem dynamischen, internationalen Arbeitsumfeld
* Ein wettbewerbsfähiges Vergütungs\- und Leistungspaket


 Werde Teil unseres Teams und gestalte aktiv die Zukunft unserer Fertigungsprozesse mit. Sende uns deine Online\-Bewerbung inklusive Lebenslauf und Gehaltsvorstellungen. Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen.

title: Development Engineer (80–100%)
name: Development Engineer (80–100%)
description:
**Get to know Climeworks**
 Climeworks is a leading high\-quality carbon removal provider, combining decades of expertise in Direct Air Capture (DAC) technology with a holistic approach to carbon removal solutions.
   

  

 Climeworks advises companies on their carbon removal strategies and provides tailored portfolios of nature\-based and engineered approaches, offering end\-to\-end services to help achieve net\-zero goals. The company runs the world's first two DAC plants in Iceland, demonstrating its core commitment to high\-quality carbon removal that is backed by over 15 years of pioneering research, development, and deployment.
   

  

 By advancing the most reliable solutions in the market, Climeworks accelerates the global transition to net zero, unlocking economic value for businesses, governments, and society.
   

  

 We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the world’s greatest challenge.
   

  

 Will you join us?
   

  

**Job description**
* Collector Concepts Development: You contribute to the design and development of new CO₂ collector system architectures, translating sorbent and process requirements into practical, manufacturable equipment. You support the creation of innovative concepts and help bring them to life through engineering design.
* Prototyping \& Testing: You take a hands\-on role in prototyping and testing collector concepts and subsystems. You design and execute experiments to validate performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimize designs for reliability and scalability.
* Cross\-Functional Collaboration: You work closely with sorbent scientists, process engineers, and mechanical designers to ensure seamless integration of materials and processes into collector systems. You support the scale\-up of technologies from lab to pilot and industrial scale.
* Engineering \& Industrialisation Support: You assist in the transition from concept to manufacturable product, contributing to detail design, design\-for\-manufacture, and compliance. You collaborate with the Industrialisation team to ensure robust implementation of new technologies.
* Documentation \& Continuous Improvement: You document designs, test results, and learnings to support knowledge sharing and accelerate development cycles. You actively contribute to improving engineering processes and practices.


**Your Story**
 Job requirements
   

  

* Education \& Experience: You hold a degree in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, or a related field. You have 2–5 years of experience in equipment development, ideally involving thermal systems, vacuum, or steam processes.
* Hands\-On Innovation: You have experience building and testing lab\-scale or pilot\-scale hardware. You enjoy solving engineering challenges and iterating quickly to improve designs.
* Technical Skills: You are proficient in CAD software (preferably SolidWorks) and have a good understanding of mechanical design, prototyping, and testing. Familiarity with sorbents, adsorption/desorption processes, or thermal separation technologies is a plus.
* Teamwork \& Communication: You thrive in multidisciplinary teams and communicate effectively across functions. You bring a proactive mindset and a collaborative spirit to your work.


**Our promise:** 
 At Climeworks, you are accepted for who you are, and we are committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued. We encourage
 *all* 
 qualified applicants to apply – regardless of background, identity, or experience. Studies show that women and individuals from minority backgrounds often only apply for jobs when they meet 100% of the listed criteria. If this sounds like you, don’t hold back. If you think you’d make a great fit for this role, we’d love to hear from you, even if you don’t check every single box. Let’s tackle one of humankind’s greatest challenges together.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Time Off: Enjoy 25 paid vacation days every year, plus public holidays.
* Flexibility: Work how it suits you best. We offer a hybrid work setup and up to 4 weeks of remote work annually within any EU country.
* Ownership: Fair base pay paired with an equity package – because your contributions matter.
* Family Support: Inclusive parental leave.
* Continuous Learning: Dedicated budget to invest in your professional growth.
* Referral Rewards: Help us grow our team and earn bonuses for your successful referrals.


**Salary:** 
 At Climeworks, salary ranges are assigned to a job based on the level of seniority and the location specific market median of similar jobs according to external benchmark surveys. Individual compensation depends on your skills, experience, and the value you bring to the team.
   

  

**Formalities**
* This position is based in Opfikon, Zurich, and we ask that you work onsite at least three days per week.
* The percentage in the job title means flexibility – choose full\-time or part\-time based on what works for you.
* We do not accept candidate profiles through recruitment agencies.

title: Engineering Manager
name: Engineering Manager
description:
In a Nutshell
   

  

* We're hunting for an Engineering Manager who leads by example
* Minimum 3 years software engineering experience \+ 2 years leading technical teams \- no exceptions
* You'll build and lead a team of 8\-12 engineers who deliver mission\-critical e\-commerce systems
* You'll report directly to our CTO


 What's BÆRSkin Tactical Supply Co.?
   

  

 We don't just make outdoor gear. We make all\-weather wearable armour that allows everyone to survive the wild \- no matter the conditions.
   

  

 BÆRSkin Tactical Supply Co. is part of
 **Div Brands** 
 \- a global, remote\-first e\-commerce company that specializes in launching data\-driven D2C apparel brands. We're in a transition phase, evolving from Div Brands' multi\-brand approach to focus specifically on BÆRSkin's mission. You'll be working for Div Brands/BÆRSkin as we make this strategic shift toward becoming the definitive brand for tactical outdoor gear.
   

  

 Our customers are
 **Men of Action** 
 \- quality\-focused, no\-nonsense guys who've earned their stripes and demand gear
 **Built for the Brave** 
 . They don't settle for mediocre, and neither do we. Every line of code we write, every feature we build, every pixel we place serves one purpose: delivering an experience worthy of our customers' standards.
   

  

 We're a lean, focused team that believes in doing things right the first time. Like our gear, our tech stack is built to last and perform when it matters most.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 You'll lead the squad that powers our digital experience \- building and managing the team that keeps our systems mission\-ready 24/7\. This isn't about managing from an ivory tower. This is about rolling up your sleeves, clearing obstacles, and ensuring your team has what they need to deliver excellence.
   

  

**Your mission:**
* Build and lead a high\-performing engineering team of 8\-12 developers
* Set technical direction and maintain code quality standards that match our brand promise
* Remove roadblocks and create the conditions for your team to do their best work \- Balance delivery velocity with sustainable engineering practices
* Mentor and develop engineers at all levels \- from junior developers to senior contributors
* Drive technical initiatives across payments, integrations, search, AI, and core e\-commerce systems
* Own the technical hiring process \- finding talent that fits our culture and standards
* Maintain hands\-on technical credibility while scaling your leadership impact


 You'll work directly with our CTO to shape the future of our engineering organization. If you're the type who leads by example, holds high standards, and knows how to get the best out of people, this is your command.
   

  

 The Arsenal (Tech Stack)
   

  

* TypeScript across all codebases \- because strong typing prevents weak code
* Multi\-cloud infrastructure with microservices and event\-driven architecture
* Node.js and Bun powering our backend microservices
* REST APIs for service communication
* Next.js (React) on the frontend


 You don't need to be an expert in everything, but you need to understand enough to make informed decisions, review architecture, and speak the language of your team.
   

  

 What's In It For You
   

  

**The Practical Stuff:**
* Fully remote work \- because good code doesn't require a specific zip code
* Competitive salary with regular performance reviews
* 26 days paid leave (you'll have earned it)
* Parental leave when life happens
* Permanent full\-time position with 6\-month trial period


**The Real Benefits:**
* Work with a team that respects your expertise
* Build systems that matter to customers who care about quality
* Learn from seasoned professionals who've been in the trenches
* Career growth in a company that's built to last, not built to flip


 What We're Looking For
   

  

**The Non\-Negotiables:**
* 3\+ years hands\-on software engineering experience (TypeScript/Node/React preferred)
* 2\+ years leading or managing technical teams
* Proven ability to build, grow, and retain engineering talent
* Strong organizational skills and structured approach to team management
* Go\-getter attitude with high ownership and independence
* Experience coaching and mentoring engineers at different career stages
* Track record in fast\-growing companies where you've scaled teams and systems


**The Nice\-to\-Haves:**
* E\-commerce or D2C experience
* Experience with remote\-first engineering teams
* Background in startups or high\-growth environments


**What We're NOT Looking For:**
* Micromanagers who need to review every commit
* People who manage by spreadsheet instead of leading by example
* Leaders who've never written production code
* Anyone who thinks "that's not my job" when their team needs support


 Ready to Apply?
   

  

 Send us your CV and GitHub link \- we want to see your code in action. No cover letter novels \- your work speaks louder than words.
   

  

 We'll get back to quality candidates quickly. Our process is straightforward but thorough: screening interview, technical conversations with our CTO, hands\-on coding challenges, and a final meeting. We'll test your abilities, but we also want to see how you think and leverage available tools \- including AI and other resources \- to work smarter, not just harder. Expect 3\-6 weeks from application to decision.
   

  

 FAQ
   

  

**How long is the contract?**
 Full\-time permanent position with a 6\-month trial period. We're looking for long\-term team members, not short\-term contractors.
   

  

**What's the interview process like?**
 First Interview with CTO → Technical chat with CTO → Technical chat with CTO (again) → Final meeting. We'll test both your technical skills and your ability to use modern tools effectively. We keep it focused \- just like our code.
   

  

**Will I get feedback if not selected?**
 We provide feedback to candidates who make it past the initial screening. For early\-stage applications, we unfortunately can't provide individual feedback.
   

  

**Do you work with recruiters?**
 No. We handle our own hiring. Please don't contact us with recruiting services.

title: Mechanical Electrical Engineer
name: Mechanical Electrical Engineer
description:
**We’re Carbon60…building a better future.** 




 Our approach spans beyond traditional recruitment services. As sector experts, we partner with market\-leading engineering specialists to deliver pioneering projects.
 



 Combining sector passion with technical aptitude, we’re dedicated to people and to making a difference to deliver quality bespoke, people\-led recruitment solutions.
 



 We are a trusted recruitment provider, partner and developer of people with some of the largest employers in the market.
 



  





 For our client working in aviation and located at Basel Euroairport we are looking for a Mechanical/Electrical Engineer.
 



  




* **Start date:** 
 ASAP
* **Planned duration:** 
 3 months but long\-term planned
* **Workplace:** 
 Basel Euroairport
* **Workload:** 
 100%



  





**Tasks \& Responsibilities:**




**Electrical Tasks:** 



* Lead and support electrical activities across projects, ensuring design principles are applied consistently and effectively.
* Contribute to quotations by performing aircraft surveys and validating project assumptions and hours.
* Design electrical system architectures and select components that meet RTCA DO\-160 and DO\-178 requirements.
* Collaborate with certification teams to define compliance strategies and support production environments.
* Create and revise engineering drawings aligned with project milestones, design rules, and quality standards.
* Coordinate with suppliers to define interfaces and ensure smooth integration.
* Drive continuous improvement, identify risks, and resolve roadblocks to keep projects on track.
* Participate in testing, prepare reports, and support certification documentation.
* Lead electrical activities on projects or initiatives, and act as backup for the Electrical Leader when needed.



  





**Mechanical tasks:** 



* Mechanical design/structures according to established Design principles under the supervision of the Mechanical Lead during the Design cycle.
* Make 3D engineering models and 2D drawings for mechanical parts, as well as make designs and assembly and installation drawings according to the rules and processes of mechanical engineering design (materials and processes guidelines, sheet metal rules, mechanized rules, construction rules). selection and installation of standards and fasteners, bonding and grounding, etc.).
* Definition of mechanical interfaces with the supplier/customer.
* Support the manufacturing and installation process (Review, Deviation Sheets, Concession).
* Ensure a design\-to\-weight and design\-to\-cost approach in accordance with project requirements.
* Identify risk elements and participate in their evaluation and propose efficient and innovative solutions.
* Manage/participate in the mechanical design of different projects.
* Collaborate with different specialists to ensure the degree of compliance with regulations (Production Engineering, Stress, CVE, flammability, suppliers, etc.).
* Provide support to the testing process and the preparation of the corresponding report.
* Support to Quotations of the different projects and make quotations for small projects if necessary.
* Carry out technical inspections of the aircraft (photographs, dimensions, 3D scanning...).
* Record of lessons learned to ensure the efficiency of future projects.



  





**Must Haves:**



* Bachelor’s degree in electrical or mechanical engineering, or a related aeronautic professional field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in (aircraft) electrical or mechanical engineering and team/project management.
* Proficiency in CAD tools such as AutoCAD and TeamCenter, plus Microsoft Office. Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset aligned with the client’s values.
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, high\-demand environment.
* Fluency in English is required, French and/or German are a plus.



  





 This contract is for 3 Months (might be extended) or even become permanent.
 



  





 Applicants need to be European or Swiss citizens or holding a Swiss permit.
 



  





 I'm looking forward to learn more about you!
 



  





 We are fully committed to equal opportunity engagement and strive for diversity among our external workforce.

title: Junior Analysis Engineer
name: Junior Analysis Engineer
description:
The
 **Junior Analysis Engineer** 
 supports the engineering team by performing structural and mechanical analyses, simulations, and optimizations. This role is ideal for candidates passionate about aerospace engineering and eager to develop key competencies in a dynamic environment.
 



  





**Responsabilities**

* Develop mathematical models and perform structural\-mechanical simulations and optimizations using
 **MSC NASTRAN** 
 and
 **Altair Hyperworks (Optistruct)** 
 .
* Conduct strength analyses for lightweight structures.
* Create predictions and correlations for static and dynamic experiments.
* Prepare technical reports and presentations (primarily in English).
* Participate in meetings, reviews, and present work to clients.
* Contribute to improving Stress Office expertise and efficiency (new methods, tools, standardization).
* Plan, coordinate, and monitor technical project work in calculation areas.
* Manage budgets and deadlines for calculation activities.
* Respond to RIDs (Review Item Discrepancies).



  





**Requirements**




  




* Master’s degree in
 **Mechanical Engineering** 
 or
 **Aerospace Engineering** 
 (University/ETH).
* Experience in aerospace or equivalent fields, including:
* FE Analysis with
 **MSC NASTRAN** 
 ,
 **Altair Hyperworks/Optistruct** 
 , and/or
 **Abaqus \& NX Siemens** 
 .
* FEM simulation of vibro\-acoustic phenomena.
* Structural analysis and mechanical engineering.
* Proficiency in FE analysis using NASTRAN, Optistruct, and/or Abaqus \& NX Siemens.
* Knowledge of static and dynamic analysis.
* Experience automating FEM simulations using
 **Python API** 
 .
* Familiarity with structures, mechanisms, and solar wings.
* Analysis of composites, sandwich structures, and lightweight materials is a plus.
* Knowledge of structures, mechanisms, and antennas is nice to have.
* Understanding of mechanical layout for aerospace structures and components.

**Please note, that we only accept applicants with Swiss or EU/EFTA citizenship or applicants with an existing and valid residence and work permit for Switzerland.** 




**Capgemini Engineering is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Individuals with Disabilities.** 




  





**Our offer**

title: Composite Production Engineer
name: Composite Production Engineer
description:
**Our Team**
 Welcome to the Audi F1 Project.
   

  

 Audi will be competing in the FIA Formula 1 World Championship from 2026\.
   

  

 The new team has three locations. Audi's Motorsport Competence Center in Neuburg (Germany) is considered one of the most modern of its kind in Europe. The Sauber Group's Formula 1 factory in Hinwil (Switzerland) is known for its innovative technologies and passion for racing. The Sauber Motorsport Technical Center, UK will be operational this year. Our Power Unit comes from Neuburg, while Hinwil is responsible for the development of the chassis and race operations.
   

  

 What you need? The mindset of an athlete. If you are someone for whom giving up isn’t an option and limits are just something to be overcome, you can bring Vorsprung durch Technik to Formula 1 with us. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history. Become part of this unique project and make motorsport history.
   

  

 This position for the Audi F1 Project is at Sauber in Hinwil (Switzerland).
   

  

**Your mission**
* Be the daily interface between production and design office
* Support design and production in developing and optimizing components
* Provide technical support to the involved departments and transfer information to manufacture the tool or part
* Test materials, ensure quality is maintained in the area of composite part manufacturing and take decisions regarding quality issues of non\-class A parts (e.g. inserts, foams, bodywork parts, etc.)
* Maintain an overview of manufacturing quality once the component is productionised in the manufacturing departments
* Ensure problem solving is efficient and transparent throughout the entire design/manufacturing processes
* Support projects and participate in the direction and development of composite manufacturing implementations


**Your profile**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering or equivalent qualification/experience
* A minimum of 5 years of experience with high and autoclave cured composites
* Evident expertise and accomplishments in all fields of composite manufacturing as well as good knowledge of various composite manufacturing methods
* Knowledge of CAD, CATIA V6 preferred and the ability to use standard SW packages (e.g. MS Office)
* Excellent technical, organizational and communicative competencies with the ability to take initiatives and be responsible
* Creative, self\-motivated, honest and open\-minded personality with high flexibility for working in a shift model (early and night shifts)
* Proficiency in English language skills. German language skills will be an advantage

title: Development Engineer (80–100%)
name: Development Engineer (80–100%)
description:
**Get to know Climeworks**
 Climeworks is a leading high\-quality carbon removal provider, combining decades of expertise in Direct Air Capture (DAC) technology with a holistic approach to carbon removal solutions.
   

  

 Climeworks advises companies on their carbon removal strategies and provides tailored portfolios of nature\-based and engineered approaches, offering end\-to\-end services to help achieve net\-zero goals. The company runs the world's first two DAC plants in Iceland, demonstrating its core commitment to high\-quality carbon removal that is backed by over 15 years of pioneering research, development, and deployment.
   

  

 By advancing the most reliable solutions in the market, Climeworks accelerates the global transition to net zero, unlocking economic value for businesses, governments, and society.
   

  

 We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the world’s greatest challenge.
   

  

 Will you join us?
   

  

**Job description**
* Collector Concepts Development: You contribute to the design and development of new CO₂ collector system architectures, translating sorbent and process requirements into practical, manufacturable equipment. You support the creation of innovative concepts and help bring them to life through engineering design.
* Prototyping \& Testing: You take a hands\-on role in prototyping and testing collector concepts and subsystems. You design and execute experiments to validate performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimize designs for reliability and scalability.
* Cross\-Functional Collaboration: You work closely with sorbent scientists, process engineers, and mechanical designers to ensure seamless integration of materials and processes into collector systems. You support the scale\-up of technologies from lab to pilot and industrial scale.
* Engineering \& Industrialisation Support: You assist in the transition from concept to manufacturable product, contributing to detail design, design\-for\-manufacture, and compliance. You collaborate with the Industrialisation team to ensure robust implementation of new technologies.
* Documentation \& Continuous Improvement: You document designs, test results, and learnings to support knowledge sharing and accelerate development cycles. You actively contribute to improving engineering processes and practices.


**Your Story**
 Job requirements
   

  

* Education \& Experience: You hold a degree in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, or a related field. You have 2–5 years of experience in equipment development, ideally involving thermal systems, vacuum, or steam processes.
* Hands\-On Innovation: You have experience building and testing lab\-scale or pilot\-scale hardware. You enjoy solving engineering challenges and iterating quickly to improve designs.
* Technical Skills: You are proficient in CAD software (preferably SolidWorks) and have a good understanding of mechanical design, prototyping, and testing. Familiarity with sorbents, adsorption/desorption processes, or thermal separation technologies is a plus.
* Teamwork \& Communication: You thrive in multidisciplinary teams and communicate effectively across functions. You bring a proactive mindset and a collaborative spirit to your work.


**Our promise:** 
 At Climeworks, you are accepted for who you are, and we are committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued. We encourage
 *all* 
 qualified applicants to apply – regardless of background, identity, or experience. Studies show that women and individuals from minority backgrounds often only apply for jobs when they meet 100% of the listed criteria. If this sounds like you, don’t hold back. If you think you’d make a great fit for this role, we’d love to hear from you, even if you don’t check every single box. Let’s tackle one of humankind’s greatest challenges together.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Time Off: Enjoy 25 paid vacation days every year, plus public holidays.
* Flexibility: Work how it suits you best. We offer a hybrid work setup and up to 4 weeks of remote work annually within any EU country.
* Ownership: Fair base pay paired with an equity package – because your contributions matter.
* Family Support: Inclusive parental leave.
* Continuous Learning: Dedicated budget to invest in your professional growth.
* Referral Rewards: Help us grow our team and earn bonuses for your successful referrals.


**Salary:** 
 At Climeworks, salary ranges are assigned to a job based on the level of seniority and the location specific market median of similar jobs according to external benchmark surveys. Individual compensation depends on your skills, experience, and the value you bring to the team.
   

  

**Formalities**
* This position is based in Opfikon, Zurich, and we ask that you work onsite at least three days per week.
* The percentage in the job title means flexibility – choose full\-time or part\-time based on what works for you.
* We do not accept candidate profiles through recruitment agencies.

title: Engineering Manager
name: Engineering Manager
description:
In a Nutshell
   

  

* We're hunting for an Engineering Manager who leads by example
* Minimum 3 years software engineering experience \+ 2 years leading technical teams \- no exceptions
* You'll build and lead a team of 8\-12 engineers who deliver mission\-critical e\-commerce systems
* You'll report directly to our CTO


 What's BÆRSkin Tactical Supply Co.?
   

  

 We don't just make outdoor gear. We make all\-weather wearable armour that allows everyone to survive the wild \- no matter the conditions.
   

  

 BÆRSkin Tactical Supply Co. is part of
 **Div Brands** 
 \- a global, remote\-first e\-commerce company that specializes in launching data\-driven D2C apparel brands. We're in a transition phase, evolving from Div Brands' multi\-brand approach to focus specifically on BÆRSkin's mission. You'll be working for Div Brands/BÆRSkin as we make this strategic shift toward becoming the definitive brand for tactical outdoor gear.
   

  

 Our customers are
 **Men of Action** 
 \- quality\-focused, no\-nonsense guys who've earned their stripes and demand gear
 **Built for the Brave** 
 . They don't settle for mediocre, and neither do we. Every line of code we write, every feature we build, every pixel we place serves one purpose: delivering an experience worthy of our customers' standards.
   

  

 We're a lean, focused team that believes in doing things right the first time. Like our gear, our tech stack is built to last and perform when it matters most.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 You'll lead the squad that powers our digital experience \- building and managing the team that keeps our systems mission\-ready 24/7\. This isn't about managing from an ivory tower. This is about rolling up your sleeves, clearing obstacles, and ensuring your team has what they need to deliver excellence.
   

  

**Your mission:**
* Build and lead a high\-performing engineering team of 8\-12 developers
* Set technical direction and maintain code quality standards that match our brand promise
* Remove roadblocks and create the conditions for your team to do their best work \- Balance delivery velocity with sustainable engineering practices
* Mentor and develop engineers at all levels \- from junior developers to senior contributors
* Drive technical initiatives across payments, integrations, search, AI, and core e\-commerce systems
* Own the technical hiring process \- finding talent that fits our culture and standards
* Maintain hands\-on technical credibility while scaling your leadership impact


 You'll work directly with our CTO to shape the future of our engineering organization. If you're the type who leads by example, holds high standards, and knows how to get the best out of people, this is your command.
   

  

 The Arsenal (Tech Stack)
   

  

* TypeScript across all codebases \- because strong typing prevents weak code
* Multi\-cloud infrastructure with microservices and event\-driven architecture
* Node.js and Bun powering our backend microservices
* REST APIs for service communication
* Next.js (React) on the frontend


 You don't need to be an expert in everything, but you need to understand enough to make informed decisions, review architecture, and speak the language of your team.
   

  

 What's In It For You
   

  

**The Practical Stuff:**
* Fully remote work \- because good code doesn't require a specific zip code
* Competitive salary with regular performance reviews
* 26 days paid leave (you'll have earned it)
* Parental leave when life happens
* Permanent full\-time position with 6\-month trial period


**The Real Benefits:**
* Work with a team that respects your expertise
* Build systems that matter to customers who care about quality
* Learn from seasoned professionals who've been in the trenches
* Career growth in a company that's built to last, not built to flip


 What We're Looking For
   

  

**The Non\-Negotiables:**
* 3\+ years hands\-on software engineering experience (TypeScript/Node/React preferred)
* 2\+ years leading or managing technical teams
* Proven ability to build, grow, and retain engineering talent
* Strong organizational skills and structured approach to team management
* Go\-getter attitude with high ownership and independence
* Experience coaching and mentoring engineers at different career stages
* Track record in fast\-growing companies where you've scaled teams and systems


**The Nice\-to\-Haves:**
* E\-commerce or D2C experience
* Experience with remote\-first engineering teams
* Background in startups or high\-growth environments


**What We're NOT Looking For:**
* Micromanagers who need to review every commit
* People who manage by spreadsheet instead of leading by example
* Leaders who've never written production code
* Anyone who thinks "that's not my job" when their team needs support


 Ready to Apply?
   

  

 Send us your CV and GitHub link \- we want to see your code in action. No cover letter novels \- your work speaks louder than words.
   

  

 We'll get back to quality candidates quickly. Our process is straightforward but thorough: screening interview, technical conversations with our CTO, hands\-on coding challenges, and a final meeting. We'll test your abilities, but we also want to see how you think and leverage available tools \- including AI and other resources \- to work smarter, not just harder. Expect 3\-6 weeks from application to decision.
   

  

 FAQ
   

  

**How long is the contract?**
 Full\-time permanent position with a 6\-month trial period. We're looking for long\-term team members, not short\-term contractors.
   

  

**What's the interview process like?**
 First Interview with CTO → Technical chat with CTO → Technical chat with CTO (again) → Final meeting. We'll test both your technical skills and your ability to use modern tools effectively. We keep it focused \- just like our code.
   

  

**Will I get feedback if not selected?**
 We provide feedback to candidates who make it past the initial screening. For early\-stage applications, we unfortunately can't provide individual feedback.
   

  

**Do you work with recruiters?**
 No. We handle our own hiring. Please don't contact us with recruiting services.

title: Mechanical Electrical Engineer
name: Mechanical Electrical Engineer
description:
**We’re Carbon60…building a better future.** 




 Our approach spans beyond traditional recruitment services. As sector experts, we partner with market\-leading engineering specialists to deliver pioneering projects.
 



 Combining sector passion with technical aptitude, we’re dedicated to people and to making a difference to deliver quality bespoke, people\-led recruitment solutions.
 



 We are a trusted recruitment provider, partner and developer of people with some of the largest employers in the market.
 



  





 For our client working in aviation and located at Basel Euroairport we are looking for a Mechanical/Electrical Engineer.
 



  




* **Start date:** 
 ASAP
* **Planned duration:** 
 3 months but long\-term planned
* **Workplace:** 
 Basel Euroairport
* **Workload:** 
 100%



  





**Tasks \& Responsibilities:**




**Electrical Tasks:** 



* Lead and support electrical activities across projects, ensuring design principles are applied consistently and effectively.
* Contribute to quotations by performing aircraft surveys and validating project assumptions and hours.
* Design electrical system architectures and select components that meet RTCA DO\-160 and DO\-178 requirements.
* Collaborate with certification teams to define compliance strategies and support production environments.
* Create and revise engineering drawings aligned with project milestones, design rules, and quality standards.
* Coordinate with suppliers to define interfaces and ensure smooth integration.
* Drive continuous improvement, identify risks, and resolve roadblocks to keep projects on track.
* Participate in testing, prepare reports, and support certification documentation.
* Lead electrical activities on projects or initiatives, and act as backup for the Electrical Leader when needed.



  





**Mechanical tasks:** 



* Mechanical design/structures according to established Design principles under the supervision of the Mechanical Lead during the Design cycle.
* Make 3D engineering models and 2D drawings for mechanical parts, as well as make designs and assembly and installation drawings according to the rules and processes of mechanical engineering design (materials and processes guidelines, sheet metal rules, mechanized rules, construction rules). selection and installation of standards and fasteners, bonding and grounding, etc.).
* Definition of mechanical interfaces with the supplier/customer.
* Support the manufacturing and installation process (Review, Deviation Sheets, Concession).
* Ensure a design\-to\-weight and design\-to\-cost approach in accordance with project requirements.
* Identify risk elements and participate in their evaluation and propose efficient and innovative solutions.
* Manage/participate in the mechanical design of different projects.
* Collaborate with different specialists to ensure the degree of compliance with regulations (Production Engineering, Stress, CVE, flammability, suppliers, etc.).
* Provide support to the testing process and the preparation of the corresponding report.
* Support to Quotations of the different projects and make quotations for small projects if necessary.
* Carry out technical inspections of the aircraft (photographs, dimensions, 3D scanning...).
* Record of lessons learned to ensure the efficiency of future projects.



  





**Must Haves:**



* Bachelor’s degree in electrical or mechanical engineering, or a related aeronautic professional field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in (aircraft) electrical or mechanical engineering and team/project management.
* Proficiency in CAD tools such as AutoCAD and TeamCenter, plus Microsoft Office. Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset aligned with the client’s values.
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced, high\-demand environment.
* Fluency in English is required, French and/or German are a plus.



  





 This contract is for 3 Months (might be extended) or even become permanent.
 



  





 Applicants need to be European or Swiss citizens or holding a Swiss permit.
 



  





 I'm looking forward to learn more about you!
 



  





 We are fully committed to equal opportunity engagement and strive for diversity among our external workforce.

description:

 **compilers, embedded systems, AI models, and DSP algorithms** 
 . This is a full\-time permanently employed position.
 



  





 If you love C\+\+, performance tuning, and designing software that makes hardware fly — this will excite you!
 



  





**💡 What this role is really about** 




 You’ll design the software foundation that powers a new class of compute hardware — from compilers and runtimes down to hardware\-aware optimizations for AI and DSP operations.
 



 Expect high ownership and deep involvement in both architecture \& performance\-critical decisions.
 



  





**🚀 What you’ll be doing** 



* 🧩 Designing low\-level runtimes, libraries \& tooling for embedded \+ accelerator\-class platforms
* 🧠 Implementing compiler components (MLIR/LLVM passes, IR transforms, backend lowering)
* 🔊 Mapping
 **AI models and DSP algorithms** 
 efficiently onto custom hardware
* 📊 Building profiling \+ benchmarking pipelines to track real performance gains
* 🤝 Working with architecture \& hardware teams on HW/SW co\-design
* 🧪 Improving CI, testing strategy \& release processes
* 📘 Producing clean documentation, examples \& reference projects



  





**🔍 What you need to succeed** 




 To excel here, you should be comfortable at the intersection of
 **compilers, embedded systems, AI, and DSP performance** 
 .
 


* 🔵
 **Strong hands\-on compiler engineering experience** 
 (LLVM/MLIR, IR, backend codegen, etc.) —
 **\#1 requirement**
* 🟦 Excellent
 **C\+\+** 
 and strong
 **Python** 
 skills
* 🧭 Background in
 **embedded systems or low\-level runtime development**
* 🧠 Experience with
 **AI workloads** 
 (edge inference, operator lowering, model execution, quantization, or similar)
* 🔊 Experience with
 **DSP or numerical algorithm design** 
 is highly advantageous
* 📚 Ability to read \& interpret hardware documentation
* ⚡ Experience in
 **profiling, tracing, optimizing memory usage, concurrency, and overall performance**
* 📦 Track record of delivering
 **production\-quality systems**
* 🚀 Exposure to
 **CUDA/OpenCL, DSP kernels, IREE, TVM, ONNX runtimes, TFLite Micro** 
 is a strong plus
* 🔁 Familiarity with CI/CD and SDK packaging is beneficial
* 🤝 Clear communication \& strong collaboration skills across hardware/software teams



  





**🏭 Industry background that works well** 




 Engineers coming from
 **semiconductors, embedded compute, compiler/toolchain development, AI accelerators, DSP, or high\-performance systems** 
 typically thrive here.
 



  





**🌍 Location \& Work Style** 




 📌 Zürich, Switzerland
 



 🏠 Hybrid setup (mix of onsite collaboration \+ remote flexibility)

title: Senior Data Scientist Customer Value
name: Senior Data Scientist Customer Value
description:
**Your future starts here**
 Als Senior Data Scientist im Bereich Customer Value Management (CVM) bei Swisscom gestaltest du die datengetriebene Zukunft der Kundeninteraktion aktiv mit. Du wirst Teil eines hochmotivierten Teams, das mit Machine Learning (ML) innovative Trigger\-Kampagnen entwickelt und umsetzt. CVM ist ein strategisch bedeutendes Thema bei Swisscom – hier treffen datenbasierte Entscheidungen auf echten Business Impact. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit Business\-Teams entwickelst und optimierst ML Modelle, die unsere Kundenkommunikation intelligenter und effizienter machen. Wenn du Modellierfähigkeiten mit Innovationsfreude in der Telekommunikationsindustrie verbindest, findest du hier die ideale Plattform, um deine Ideen zu verwirklichen.
   

  

* Entwicklung, Betrieb und Optimierung von Machine\-Learning\-Modellen für zielgenaue Trigger im Telekommunikationsumfeld
* Ausrichtung von Zielauswahl und Modellen auf Geschäftsziele mit Fokus auf Wertbeitrag
* Kontinuierliche Entwicklung und Optimierung fortschrittlicher Filter\- und Segmentierungsstrategien zur Verbesserung der Zielgruppengenauigkeit
* Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Customer Value und Revenue Lead zur Implementierung, Verfeinerung und Skalierung von Strategien
* Fortlaufende Überwachung der Modellleistung und Coaching von weniger erfahrenen Teammitgliedern


**Deine Skills**
* Abschluss (ETH/Uni/FH) in Informatik, Data Science, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem vergleichbaren technischen/naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich
* Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Deployment von Machine\-Learning\-Modellen im Telekommunikationsumfeld und im Customer Value Management
* Relevante Erfahrungen in der Strategieberatung und in internationalen Firmen im Bereich CVM (d.h. Churn Prediction, CLTV, Next Best Action und Preisoptimierung)
* Sehr gute Kenntnisse in ML\-Algorithmen, Predictive Modeling und datengetriebenen Entscheidungsprozessen, mit Praxiserfahrung im AWS\-Ökosystem
* Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python, SageMaker AI, sowie in AWS\-Tools wie z.B. S3, Lambda und Athena für Datenverarbeitung und Modellbereitstellung
* Starkes Verständnis für komplexe Datenanalysen und Performance\-Optimierung der CVM\-Modelle zur stetigen Verbesserung von z.B. Churn Modellierung
* Relevante Erfahrungen in Erstellung von Management\-Dashboards mit AWS Analytics\-Services wie QuickSight (z.B. mit Churn Performance oder Margenentwicklung)
* Relevante Erfahrungen in Zusammenarbeit mit Business\-Teams, um technische Lösungen verständlich zu präsentieren
* Freude an Zusammenarbeit und am Coaching weniger erfahrener Teammitglieder
* Fliessende Englischkenntnisse und gute Deutschkenntnisse erforderlich


 Bei uns hast du die Möglichkeit, in einem unserer Offices in der Schweiz oder im Homeoffice zu arbeiten. Dabei kommst du mit agilen Arbeitsmethoden und den neuesten Technologien in Kontakt. Wir bieten eine flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung, um deinen persönlichen Bedürfnissen gerecht zu werden. Als Mitarbeitende\*r von Swisscom kannst du dich auf eine Vielzahl von attraktiven Leistungen freuen, die deine Arbeitserfahrung bereichern werden. Dazu gehören ein angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld, finanzielle Vorteile und spannende Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung. Benefits
   

  

**Is it a match? Apply now.**
**Discover your possibilities**
**Any questions?**
 Here you'll find answers to the most important and frequently asked questions.
   

  

*To all recruitment agencies: Swisscom does not accept agency CVs. Please do not forward CVs to our job's alias, Swisscom employees or any other organisation location. Swisscom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs.*

 Rouven Bolt
   

  

 Talent Acquisition Manager
   

  

 \+41 (58\) 2232924

 Swisscom (Schweiz) AG
   

  

 Pfingstweidstrasse 51, 8005 Zürich

title: Senior IT-Supporter 80 - 100% (m/w)
name: Senior IT-Supporter 80 - 100% (m/w)
description:
Bei unserem Kunden handelt es sich um ein schweizweit tätiges Industrieunternehmen. Um den Ausbau der internen IT voranzutreiben soll das Team vergrössert werden, daher wird nun nach einem erfahrenen IT\-Supporter am Standort in Zürich und in Bern gesucht.
   

  

 Nach Eingang Ihrer Bewerbung erhalten Sie innert 1 Woche bereits eine Rückmeldung.
   

  

**Aufgaben**
* Gewährleistung einer hohen Qualität im eigenen Aufgabenbereich
* First\-Level\-Support für Mitarbeitende, Lernende und Studierende
* Second\-Level\-Support im Workplace\-Bereich (Hardware, Betriebssysteme, Anwendungen)
* Beschaffung, Verwaltung und Wartung von ICT\-Material sowie Betreuung der Hardware
* Durchführung von Soft\- und Hardware\-Rollouts im Client\-Umfeld
* Unterstützung des ICT\-Teams bei Evaluierungen, Projekten und internen Schulungen


**Profil**
* Erfolgreich abgeschlossene Informatiker/in EFZ\-Ausbildung oder gleichwertige Qualifikation
* Mindestens fünf Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Funktion
* Fundierte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit MS Windows\-Clients und in der M365\-Umgebung
* Ausgeprägte Freude an einem dynamischen Arbeitsumfeld und am Kontakt mit vielfältigen Anspruchsgruppen
* Bereitschaft vor Ort zu arbeiten, da Home\-Office nur in Ausnahmefällen möglich ist


**Wissenswertes**
* Abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit
* Gute Sozialleistungen
* Marktgerechter Lohn
* Raum für Eigenverantwortung
* Weiterbildung wird gefördert

title: Attorney
name: Attorney
description:
📢
 **Exciting Opportunity in the Crypto \& Blockchain Industry** 




  





 If you are a seasoned corporate lawyer with a strong grasp of complex contracts and vast experience in the digital asset space, we have a great opportunity for you.
 



  





 Are you an experienced legal professional skilled in:
 


* Drafting, reviewing, and negotiating sophisticated corporate and commercial agreements?
* Advising on corporate actions such as capital increases, share issuances, and equity\-related matters?
* Navigating the evolving legal frameworks of cryptocurrency, blockchain, and DeFi?
* Supporting internal teams and stakeholders in structuring complex transactions involving digital assets?



  





**Sounds like you? Great! 🤩** 




  





 If you also check these boxes, we’d love to connect:
 


* Master of Law and admission to practice in a relevant jurisdiction
* 7\+ years of experience in corporate law with a focus on complex contracts and equity matters
* Strong understanding of the crypto and blockchain ecosystem and its legal implications
* Proven ability to work independently with sound judgment and attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills, intellectual curiosity, and a pragmatic, solution\-oriented mindset



  





**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Legal Counsel
name: Legal Counsel
description:
Job description:
   

  


 Have you ever wondered how your skills and unique background could help shape the world of tomorrow? At Tecan, we are pioneers in laboratory automation and healthcare innovation, empowering customers to advance life sciences, diagnostics, and medical product development globally. Our solutions improve lives and health by enabling innovation at scale—whether in research, applied markets, or manufacturing. Join our Legal team and bring your passion and talent to work. This is your chance to shape complex international agreements, drive real impact on the business, and accelerate your career in a truly global environment.
 



  
 



**Legal Counsel (80\-100%)** 









 Männedorf, Zürich
 








**Your contribution** 




 In this dynamic and impactful role, you will provide legal support and guidance to Tecan’s business segments. Reporting to the Director of Legal Affairs, your responsibilities will include:
 



  
 


* Drafting, reviewing, and negotiating a broad range of international commercial contracts (including development, supply, distribution, licensing, and collaboration agreements)
* Preparing and updating contract templates and policies
* Ensuring compliance with relevant laws, regulatory standards, and internal policies
* Safeguarding Tecan’s integrity and managing risk exposure
* Providing training to employees on legal matters
* Staying current with evolving laws, regulations, and legal technologies, and advising on their business impact
* Collaborating with colleagues in Legal Affairs and stakeholders across the globe



  
 



**Your background** 




 We value passion, talent, and diverse perspectives. To succeed in this role, you will bring:
 



  
 


* Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Law (bar admission is a plus)
* 2–5 years of relevant post\-graduate legal experience, ideally in an international in\-house environment or a business law firm
* Proven ability to draft and negotiate complex international commercial contracts in English
* Fluency in English and German; French is an asset
* Strong negotiation skills and sound judgment
* A proactive, business\-minded, and solution\-oriented approach
* Collaborative team spirit, integrity, resilience, and a global mindset
* Keen interest in healthcare, life sciences, and emerging legal technologies



  
 



**W** 
**hat makes working at Tecan unique** 



* A collegial and supportive team culture built on openness and trust
* The chance to make a meaningful impact on the world of tomorrow
* An international and diverse working environment
* Opportunities for career growth in a company that values both legal excellence and business impact
* Empowerment through our strong and unique Tecan culture
* Comprehensive compensation and benefits package



  
 



**Join Tecan, a great place to work!** 
 Read about our recent certification from Great Place to Work.
 








  
 



 We look forward to receiving your application online. Please submit your CV or resume (without picture and without cover letter; reference letters and diplomas are optional).
 



  
 



 Only applications that fully meet our requirements will be considered.

title: Contract Manager
name: Contract Manager
description:
Job description:
   

  


 Ever wondered how your skills and unique background could impact the world of tomorrow? Are you ready to make your mark in a global company that’s transforming laboratory automation and healthcare? At Tecan, we empower our customers to scale innovation worldwide—improving lives and advancing health. Join our Legal team and help us build the world of tomorrow.
 



  
 



**Contract Manager (80\-100%)** 









 Männedorf, Zürich
 








**Your contribution** 




 As Contract Manager, you will play a key part in ensuring efficient, risk\-aware, and business\-focused legal operations across all Tecan affiliates. Reporting to the Director of Legal Affairs, you will::
 



  
 


* Draft, review, and negotiate a wide variety of contracts for our global affiliates, including confidentiality agreements, terms \& conditions, procurement, consultancy, co\-marketing, beta testing, and key opinion leader agreements
* Provide general legal support to the business as needed
* Deliver training to employees on legal topics

 We’re not just looking for hard skills: We value passion, talent, and diverse perspectives. Whether you’re a recent graduate or have initial professional experience, we welcome your application if you are eager to build your career in international contract management. You bring:
 



  
 


* Bachelor’s degree in Law.
* Initial experience in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts in English and German, or a strong motivation to develop these skills
* Understanding of international contracts and cross\-border legal challenges.
* Fluency in English and German (written and spoken)
* A collaborative, solution\-oriented mindset and confidence to support stakeholders across multiple jurisdictions and cultures

title: Anwalt*in im Bereich Private Clients in Zürich oder Zug (80-100%)
name: Anwalt*in im Bereich Private Clients in Zürich oder Zug (80-100%)
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

**Die Gelegenheit: Dein nächstes Abenteuer wartet**
 Starte eine erfolgreiche Karriere und werde Teil unseres einzigartigen
 **Private Client Teams** 
 , um täglich spannende Herausforderungen zu meistern!
   

  

 Unsere
 **Private Clients Practice** 
 ist national und international in allen relevanten Bereichen des privaten und unternehmerischen Vermögens\-, Nachlass\- und Steuerrechts tätig. Wir konzentrieren uns auf die individuellen Bedürfnisse von vermögenden Privatpersonen, Unternehmern, Familien und Family Offices und unterstützen unsere Klienten bei einer Vielzahl von rechtlichen, steuerlichen und regulatorischen Fragestellungen. Spannende und vielseitige Mandate erwarten Dich bereits vom ersten Tag an.
   

  

**Deine Hauptaufgaben**
* Unsere Beratung fokussiert sich insbesondere auf die private Vermögens\-, Nachlass\-, Unternehmens\- und Steuerplanung
* Wir unterstützen vermögende Privatpersonen und Familien, Unternehmerinnen und Family Offices im Erreichen ihrer Familien\- und Unternehmensziele, oft in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Unternehmensberatern und Steuerexperten im In\- und Ausland
* Zu den Themen, bei denen wir unsere Klienten unterstützen, gehören: Verwaltung und Willensvollstreckung komplexer Nachlässe, Kunst, Philanthropie und Errichtung gemeinnütziger Organisationen, einschliesslich Fragen der Governance\- und des Managements, Nachlassplanung, Trusts und Stiftungen, Kauf\- und Verkauf von Immobilien, Familienrecht, Wohnsitznahme in der Schweiz
* Neben den erwähnten Rechtsgebieten bist Du bei Bedarf auch für unsere weiteren Fachgruppen tätig, vor allem in den Bereichen Corporate/Commercial und Real Estate
* Du wirst vom ersten Tag an in interessante, komplexe, internationale Projekte involviert und arbeiten direkt mit den Spezialisten aus unseren anderen EY Abteilungen und den Klienten zusammen


**Was wir suchen**
* Masterabschluss in Rechtswissenschaften wird vorausgesetzt; Anwaltspatent, Ausbildung zum eidg. dipl. Steuerexperten, Auslandstudium (z.B. LL.M.) oder Arbeitserfahrung im Ausland von Vorteil
* Idealerweise mindestens 2 bis 4 Jahre Arbeitserfahrung in der Beratung von Private Clients in einer Anwaltskanzlei, Beratungsgesellschaft oder Rechtsabteilung einer Finanzinstitution. Verfügst Du über weniger Erfahrung, aber bist motiviert, schnell viel zu lernen? Melde Dich ebenfalls
* Flexibler Teamplayer mit analytischen Fähigkeiten
* Als internationales Unternehmen setzten wir Deutsch\- und Englischkenntnisse voraus


**Was ist für Dich drin**
 Hier bei EY hast du die Chance, eine wirklich aussergewöhnliche Erfahrung zu machen. Wir statten dich mit der neuesten Technologie aus, umgeben dich mit leistungsstarken Teams und bieten dir die globale Reichweite sowie die vielfältige und inklusive Kultur, die du benötigst, um dein volles Potenzial zu entdecken. Durch unsere Coaching\- und Schulungsprogramme entwickelst du die Fähigkeiten, die du benötigst, um heute und in Zukunft relevant zu bleiben – und das alles, während du ein Netzwerk von Kollegen, Mentoren und Führungskräften aufbaust, die dich auf deinem Weg bei EY und darüber hinaus begleiten.
   

  

 Klicke hier, um mehr über unsere Vorteile und soziale Verantwortung des Unternehmens zu erfahren.
   

  

 Bist du bereit, deine Zukunft mit Zuversicht zu gestalten? Bewirb dich noch heute.
   

  

 Um während des Rekrutierungsprozesses eine gerechte und inklusive Erfahrung zu schaffen, informiere uns bitte so schnell wie möglich über Anpassungen oder Uterstützung, die du aufgrund einer Behinderung benötigst.
   

  

**EY \| Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi\-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: Attorney
name: Attorney
description:
Im Auftrag unserer Klientin, einer grösseren, renommierten und international vernetzten Wirtschaftskanzlei mit einem Standort im Grossraum Aarau, suchen wir zwecks Verstärkung per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine(n) "Rechtsanwältin/Rechtsanwalt mit eigener Mandatsbasis (80\-100%)". Die Vakanz wird wie folgt beschrieben (leicht angepasster Auszug aus der Stellenbeschreibung):
 



  





  





**Aufgabengebiete:** 




  




* Beratung und Begleitung der Klientschaft, d. h. Unternehmen (v. a. KMUs) und Privatpersonen, mit Mandatsverantwortung in allen rechtlichen Fragestellungen, hauptsächlich im Gesellschaftsrecht, Vertragsrecht, IT\-Recht, Immaterialgüterrecht, Datenrecht und Recht im digitalen Raum
* Ausarbeiten von Abklärungen, Stellungnahmen usw. zu Rechtsfragen in den oben erwähnten Gebieten. Vorbereitung und Durchführung von Gründungen, Finanzierungen, Transaktionen, Restrukturierungen, Sanierungen und Liquidationen. Ausarbeiten, Prüfen und Verhandeln von Verträgen, Eingaben, Rechtsschriften und anderen rechtlich relevanten Dokumenten
* Vertretung der Klientschaft vor Gerichts\- und Verwaltungsbehörden sowie Streitbeilegung
* Einarbeiten, Anleiten und Führen jüngerer Kolleginnen und Kollegen sowie von Substitutinnen und Substituten
* Pflege der bestehenden und Akquisition von neuen, in\- und ausländischen Klienten
* Ausbau und Weiterentwicklung der Marktpräsenz, wobei eigene Akzente gesetzt werden können und sollen
* Laufende Beobachtung der nationalen und internationalen Entwicklungen in Gesetzgebung, Rechtsprechung, Branchenempfehlungen und Best Practices
* Zusammenarbeit und Koordination der Aktivitäten mit anderen, schweizerischen und internationalen Partnerkanzleien. Auswahl, Instruktion und Überwachung von Korrespondenzanwälten
* Kontakt mit nationalen und internationalen Behörden, (Branchen\-)Verbänden und anderen Organisationen
* Publikation von fachspezifischen Artikeln; Halten von Vorträgen und Durchführung von internen Schulungen



  





  





**Anforderungen:** 




  




* Schweizer Jura\-Abschluss (MLaw oder lic. iur.), ergänzt mit einem Schweizer Anwaltspatent
* Einige Jahre CH\-Berufserfahrung als RA in einer wirtschaftsrechtlich ausgerichteten Kanzlei, vorzugsweise mit einem Fokus auf die erwähnten Aufgabengebiete
* Fliessende Deutsch\- und Englischkenntnisse; weitere Sprachen wie Französisch wären von Vorteil
* Unternehmerpersönlichkeit mit solider eigener Mandatsbasis, Führungskompetenz und dem Willen, die Zukunft der Kanzlei (mit) zu gestalten und in die Partnerschaft der Aktionäre aufgenommen zu werden
* Fähigkeit, im Team oder selbständig mit Mandatsverantwortung nationale und internationale Mandate in abwechslungsreichen Aufgabengebieten zu bearbeiten
* Strukturierte, effiziente, kreative, resultat\- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise, kombiniert mit einem Flair für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge. Dadurch erkennen Sie die Bedürfnisse der anspruchsvollen Klientschaft, erarbeiten juristisch und wirtschaftlich fundierte Lösungen und gewinnen deren Vertrauen
* Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, gepaart mit hohe Leistungsbereitschaft und Durchsetzungsvermögen
* Ausgeprägte Kommunikations\-, Verhandlungs\- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
* Überzeugende Persönlichkeit mit interkultureller Kompetenz

title: Sachbearbeiter:in Vertragsverwaltung Individual Life
name: Sachbearbeiter:in Vertragsverwaltung Individual Life
description:
Komm zur AXA, der führenden Versicherung der Schweiz \- als
   

  

**Sachbearbeiter:in Vertragsverwaltung Individual Life** 
**60\-100 %
   

  

 Winterthur / Smart Working**
 Jede Erfolgsgeschichte beginnt mit dem Glauben an sich selbst.
   

  

 Als AXA sehen wir uns als Partnerin von dir, die an deiner Seite steht und an dich glaubt. Deshalb fordern und fördern aktiv und zeigen dir proaktiv Möglichkeiten für deine Zukunft auf. Wir ermutigen dich und bieten dir Freiräume, damit du die Dinge, die dir wichtig sind, mit deinem Privatleben verbinden kannst. Gemeinsam mit deinem Engagement und deinem individuellen Beitrag wird daraus eine zukunftsweisende Partnerschaft. Für dich, für uns und für unsere Kundinnen und Kunden.
   

  

 Schreibe jetzt mit uns deine eigene Erfolgsgeschichte. Know You Can.

Unsere Mandantin ist ein Schweizer Anbieter von lokalen Datacenterlösungen\- und Managed\-Services. Im exklusiven Auftrag suchen wir einen erfahrenen System Engineer, welche die technische Leitung der Datacenter Infrastruktur übernehmen will.

* Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Senior System Engineer im Bereich Windows Server.
* Fundiertes Fachwissen in VMware, NSX, vSAN und vCloud Director.
* Erfahrung mit Netzwerkarchitekturen inkl. Switching, Routing, TCP/IP, BGP und VLAN ist ein grosses Plus.
* Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse auf Stufe Muttersprache sind ein Muss.



  





 Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Wenn ja, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Bei Fragen steht Ihnen Herr Martin Werffeli gerne zur Verfügung.

 Als Senior Data Scientist im Bereich Customer Value Management (CVM) bei Swisscom gestaltest du die datengetriebene Zukunft der Kundeninteraktion aktiv mit. Du wirst Teil eines hochmotivierten Teams, das mit Machine Learning (ML) innovative Trigger\-Kampagnen entwickelt und umsetzt. CVM ist ein strategisch bedeutendes Thema bei Swisscom – hier treffen datenbasierte Entscheidungen auf echten Business Impact. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit Business\-Teams entwickelst und optimierst ML Modelle, die unsere Kundenkommunikation intelligenter und effizienter machen. Wenn du Modellierfähigkeiten mit Innovationsfreude in der Telekommunikationsindustrie verbindest, findest du hier die ideale Plattform, um deine Ideen zu verwirklichen.
   

  

* Entwicklung, Betrieb und Optimierung von Machine\-Learning\-Modellen für zielgenaue Trigger im Telekommunikationsumfeld
* Ausrichtung von Zielauswahl und Modellen auf Geschäftsziele mit Fokus auf Wertbeitrag
* Kontinuierliche Entwicklung und Optimierung fortschrittlicher Filter\- und Segmentierungsstrategien zur Verbesserung der Zielgruppengenauigkeit
* Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Customer Value und Revenue Lead zur Implementierung, Verfeinerung und Skalierung von Strategien
